chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Drew M Marley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 2 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined at future hearing.
04-04-2016 The Court sets restitution in the amount of $1500.00 to Mark J.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with Mark J or his employment. St. Dominic Church, Stephanie W., Jeanette R., or Carol S. Maintain employment. 
Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed.   Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith. FIRST 30 Days to be with Huber with release for 2 weeks for work search. LAST 30 days are STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Drew M Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 2 days)
 consecutive
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION: 2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended; 
*No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment  
*No contact with:  
Mark J. or his employment, St. Dominic Church, Stephanie W., Jeanette R., Carol S.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:   to be determined

DRGOD:  $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  60 days - first 30 days with huber (with 2 week work search), STAYED the last 30 days; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
